intro: Chaetogastra mollis, commonly known as the soft-hairy nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
